info.title: NoCFO API Documentation
info.description:
Get help and discuss in our [Slack community](https://nocfocommunity.slack.com) üëâ [**Click here to join**](https://join.slack.com/t/nocfocommunity/shared_invite/zt-3b7i1rcfp-4JmhWVTqGxzireppzCwA)

### Welcome!

Welcome to the NoCFO API Documentation! The **NoCFO API** provides secure, programmatic access to the core functionalities of the NoCFO platform, enabling seamless integration with your own applications and workflows.
With these endpoints, you can interact with a variety of features including **bookkeeping**, **invoicing**, and other financial operations.

Our API is built to be reliable, scalable, and developer-friendly, with consistent request/response structures and clear authentication methods. Whether you are building new integrations, automating repetitive tasks, or syncing data between systems, the NoCFO API offers the tools you need.

### Available Resources

We provide both **testing** and **production** environments so you can safely develop and validate your integration before going live.

- **Testing environment**: [https://api-tst.nocfo.io/docs](https://api-tst.nocfo.io/docs)
Use this environment for development and testing purposes. Data here is isolated and does not affect production systems.

- **Production environment**: [https://api-prd.nocfo.io/docs](https://api-prd.nocfo.io/docs)
Use this environment for live, real-world operations once your integration is fully tested.

### Authentication

The NoCFO API uses **token-based authentication** to ensure secure access.
To authenticate requests, you must include a valid **Personal Access Token (PAT)** in the `Authorization` header:

```http
Authorization: Token <your_token_here>
```

#### Key points to note:

- Tokens are user-specific. Any action performed with a token will be attributed to the user who created it.
- Keep your token secure ‚Äî treat it like a password. Do not share it or expose it in public repositories.
- If a token is compromised, it should be revoked immediately from your account settings.

#### Obtaining Access Tokens

You can generate and manage your access tokens directly in the NoCFO web application under Account Settings.
- Testing environment: https://login-tst.nocfo.io/auth/tokens/
- Production environment: https://login.nocfo.io/auth/tokens/

### Developer Support and Community

Join our [NoCFO Slack Community](https://nocfocommunity.slack.com) to connect with other developers, share best practices, and get direct support from our team.
In the Slack workspace, you can:
- Ask questions about API usage and integrations
- Get quick feedback and troubleshooting help
- Share your use cases and solutions with others

[**Click here to join**](https://join.slack.com/t/nocfocommunity/shared_invite/zt-3b7i1rcfp-4JmhWVTqGxzireppzCwA)

get.description: This endpoints allows you to retrieve a list of all the company's accounts and create new ones. It includes extensive filtering options and a search feature

parameters.name: is_shown
parameters.description: If set to true, it will return accounts that are selected to be shown in the UI.

parameters.name: is_used
parameters.description: If set to true, it will return accounts that have at least one entry.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter accounts by tags. Account will be shown if it has at least one associated document with the specified tag.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Filter accounts by type.

* `ASS` - Vastaavaa
* `ASS_DEP` - Poistokelpoinen omaisuus
* `ASS_VAT` - Arvonlis√§verosaatava
* `ASS_REC` - Siirtosaamiset
* `ASS_PAY` - Pankkitili / k√§teisvarat
* `ASS_DUE` - Myyntisaatavat
* `LIA` - Vastattavaa
* `LIA_EQU` - Oma p√§√§oma
* `LIA_PRE` - Edellisten tilikausien voitto
* `LIA_DUE` - Ostovelat
* `LIA_DEB` - Velat
* `LIA_ACC` - Siirtovelat
* `LIA_VAT` - Arvonlis√§verovelka
* `REV` - Tulot
* `REV_SAL` - Liikevaihtotulot (myynti)
* `REV_NO` - Verottomat tulot
* `EXP` - Menot
* `EXP_DEP` - Poistot
* `EXP_NO` - V√§hennyskelvottomat menot
* `EXP_50` - Puoliksi v√§hennyskelpoiset menot
* `EXP_TAX` - Verotili

post.description: Accepts the invoice, marking it as accepted and ready to be delivered.
Marks the invoice as a credit loss, updating its status accordingly.
post.summary: Sales Invoice - Set as Credit Loss

post.description: Disables the recurrence of the invoice, preventing it from being automatically generated in the future.
Marks the invoice as paid, updating its status and payment date.
Marks the invoice as unpaid, updating its status to accepted.

get.description: Retrieves the available delivery methods for sending the invoice. This includes email and other configured methods.

post.description: Sends the invoice to the receiver via the specified delivery method. The delivery method can be email or other configured methods.

debet_account_id.description: When the debit side only includes a payment account (e.g., a bank account), its ID can be set in this shortcut field. In this case `debet_etries` must be set blank.

debet_entries.description: List of debit entries associated with this blueprint. If debet_account_id is set, this field must be empty.

credit_account_id.description: When the credit side only includes a payment account (e.g., a bank account), its ID can be set in this shortcut field. In this case `credit_entries` must be set blank.

credit_entries.description: List of credit entries associated with this blueprint. If credit_account_id is set, this field must be empty.

expense_entries.description: In case of sales, any expenses that are not directly related to the sale can be recorded here. This is useful for recording costs that are not directly linked to a specific sale, such as overhead costs.

account_id.description: The account ID associated with this entry.

description.description: Description of the entry, providing additional context or details.

vat_code.description: The VAT code of this entry.

vat_rate.description: The VAT rate of this entry.

vat_method.description:
The VAT method for this entry.

* `0` - Bruttokirjaus
* `1` - Nettokirjaus

amount.description: The amount of this entry, in the smallest currency unit (e.g., cents).

created_at.description: The date and time when the record was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the record was last updated.

subscription_source.description: Where the current subscription plan is controlled from

created_at.description: The date and time when the record was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the record was last updated.

number.description: The document number is an automatically generated number that identifies the document in the accounting system.

is_flagged.description: Indicates whether the document is flagged for review or attention.

is_locked.description: Indicates whether the document is locked and cannot be modified.

is_draft.description: Indicates whether the document is a draft. Draft documents are not yet finalized.

date.description: The date of the document. This is the date when the document was created or issued.

description.description: A brief description of the document.

contact_id.description: Contact ID associated with this document.

contact_name.description: Contact name associated with this document.

period.description: Accounting period ID to which this document belongs.

balance.description: Total balance of the document. This value represents the net effect on accounts of type "bank account." Note that this value is typically zero if no money has yet moved, for example, when recording accounts receivable. Once money is received or paid via a bank account, the amount will be shown in this field.

attachment_ids.description: List of attachment IDs associated with this document.

type.description:
The type of the document.

* `0` - Normaali kirjaus
* `3` - Arvonlis√§verokirjaus
* `4` - Poisto
* `6` - YLE-vero
* `7` - Tulovero

blueprint.description: Blueprint is an internal term for this object, based on which the actual entries are generated.

blueprint_type.description: The blueprint type is determined programmatically, and therefore this field is read-only.

import_data.description: Import data e.g. CSV or bank transaction data associated with this document.

has_ai_generated_description.description: Deprecated: Indicates whether the description of this document was generated by AI.

entry_ui_rows.description: UI rows for entries in this document, used for rendering the entry UI.

audit_trail_last_seen_at.description: Last time the user has visited this document's activity feed.

audit_trail_has_unseen_actions.description: Indicates whether there are unseen actions in the activity feed for this document.

audit_trail_last_mention_at.description: Last time the user was mentioned in the activity feed of this document.

audit_trail_last_comment_at.description: Last time the user has commented in the activity feed of this document.

tag_ids.description: List of tag IDs associated with this document.

trace_id.description: Unique identifier attached to logs. For debugging purposes.
